description: From hep +‎ cat, from hep (“sophisticated, aware”). Compare cat (“jazz enthusiast”). Attested in the sense of “sophisticated person” from the 1920s.

entries.meaning: (informal, music) A jazz performer, especially one from the 1940s and 1950s.
(informal, dated, now often humorous) A person associated with the jazz subculture of the 1940s and 1950s.
(informal, dated) A sophisticated person, one who is stylish.
